thread.title: Milwaukee Election Day weather forecast: all-day rain and possible thunderstorms
thread.title_full: Milwaukee Election Day weather forecast: all-day rain and possible thunderstorms

author: , Journal Sentinel
title: Milwaukee Election Day weather forecast: all-day rain and possible thunderstorms
text:
Milwaukee Election Day weather forecast: all-day rain and possible thunderstorms Claire Reid Milwaukee Journal Sentinel Show Caption
Hide Caption
These Milwaukee voters were asked who they plan to vote for in 2024 These Milwaukee voters were asked who they plan to vote for in the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. Here's what they said. Tuesday, Nov. 5 is Election Day, the final day citizens in Milwaukee County and across the U.S. can vote in the 2024 Presidential Election and other political races .
On Election Day, registered voters can cast their ballots at their designated polling place. There are polling places throughout Milwaukee County; click here to find your Wisconsin polling place .
If early voting is any indication , voters should prepare for possible long lines at polling places. With lines potentially out the door, voters may want to bring their umbrellas.
According to the National Weather Service, all-day rain and potential thunderstorms are in the forecast Sunday through Tuesday, including during voting hours, due to a system moving across the Plains into the Upper Great Lakes region. On Tuesday, Milwaukee is expected to see temperatures in the low 60s.
Precipitation chances are between 90% and 100% from 1 p.m. Sunday to noon Tuesday. Periods of heavy rainfall should be expected, with daily totals in some areas between 1 and 1.5 inches, Milwaukee-Sullivan NWS meteorologist Kevin Wagner said.
There is a possibility of thunderstorms from late Sunday night until noon Tuesday. Chances are highest between 7 p.m. on Monday and midnight on Tuesday. Rain should taper off by Wednesday morning.
What to know about early voting in Milwaukee County If you'd rather avoid the rain, you can vote early and in-person at locations throughout Milwaukee County and the Milwaukee suburbs. Be sure to bring a photo ID, and proof of residence if you need to register or re-register to vote.
Click here for a full list of early voting locations in the Milwaukee area and their hours, and check out the maps below.
City of Milwaukee early voting locations Milwaukee northern suburbs early voting locations: Cedarburg, Germantown, Mequon, Port Washington, Shorewood, West Bend and more Milwaukee western suburbs early voting locations: Brookfield, Waukesha, Wauwatosa and more Milwaukee southern suburbs early voting locations: Big Bend, Franklin, Greenfield, Mukwonago, Muskego, South Milwaukee, West Allis and more Wisconsin weather radar Wisconsin weather warnings Journal Sentinel reporter Claudia Levens contributed to this report.
